meanings.definition: To tolerate or accept something unpleasant or difficult.
meanings.sent1: She was stomaching the bitter taste of the medicine to feel better.
meanings.sent2: I have a hard time stomaching horror movies because they scare me.
meanings.sent3: Even though the broccoli looked yucky, she was stomaching it to be polite.
meanings.sent4: He was stomaching the criticism from his boss like a champ.
meanings.sent5: The soldier was stomaching the pain of his injury to keep fighting.

meanings.definition: To digest food in the stomach.
meanings.sent1: After eating, the body starts stomaching the food to get nutrients.
meanings.sent2: It takes time for the stomach to stomach and break down the food we eat.
meanings.sent3: The stomach was happily stomaching the delicious meal it received.
meanings.sent4: Her stomach was stomaching the large meal like a professional eater.
meanings.sent5: The stomach was stomaching the pizza with extra cheese and pepperoni.
